author: Jake Cromling
comment: I like it.

author: Lisa Mumm
comment: This app is awesome. I just tested it with my guitar tuner without any consideration that it would actually work. It did. PERFECTLY! I have no idea how this app is free but i'm glad it is. (PS I used the LG G watch)
title: Normally I don't write reviews

author: Mike Dye
comment: Seriously people do you even test your own app? You can NOT use your voice to activate an app with wear in the title. It comes up "where" everytime and does not launch the app. Fix and get 5 stars.
title: Wear in the title.

author: Donal Thompson
comment: The idea is great - a tuner that is visual and also vibrates when you get the string perfectly tuned. But it doesn't detect the notes very well. Needs more work before coming to market. Someone will come along soon with the beta testing done in house and not by the early adopters who deserve something better.
title: Great Idea. Not so good execution.

author: Dave Kessler
comment: Moto360 mic input must be weak. Also this orphaned a wake lock that caused my moto360 to get hot and drain battery life VERY quickly. FAIL.
title: Poor recognition

author: Frank Tedesco
comment: Auto mode does not work. Have to stop and tap watch for each string. Vibe on correct tune is nice. Not ready for Prime Time.
title: Cumbersome

author: Yoav Ziv
comment: No good. It works sometimes but it keep vibrating after you close it
title: It just sucks man

author: Giobi Fasoli
comment: good idea, not working so well shamefully. neat design!
title: hardly detects the note

author: Dave Spina
comment: Can't even clearly pick up which string
title: Not even close to accurate

author: Janis Froehlig
comment: Design is good, useful if the guts worked.  Tried using a phone app to produce a pure pitch, and it's all totally off.  Who tunes to A 110?
title: Pretty, but nope.

comment: Inaccurate and not sensitive enough

author: Chris Fogelklou
comment: I prefer atHandTuner.

author: Shawna Kierski
comment: I love it
title: Awesome

author: Tony Revercomb
comment: Worked fine on LG G Watch, crashes on start on Moto 360

reply.author: MIN™
reply.content: Try check in version 1.0.3. Thank you.

author: Thunder God
comment: but not smooth enough to really be useful.

reply.author: MIN™
reply.content: I'll try a softer UX considerations. Thank you.

title: Neat idea...

author: Andy Bishop
comment: Installed the app and within 1 hour, my Moto 360 battery was dead.  Could not force close the app or even turn it off.  The watch would randomly and frequently vibrate without the app being active on the screen.  Not sure if this is a design flaw or just me not know how to use the app.
title: Killed My Watch Battery Fast

author: Dayne Putnam
comment: The app doesn't seem to properly close on the Moto 360 and stays open in the background, consuming battery.  I can feel it vibrate when sounds are happening around me is how i figured out it was still running.
title: Massive battery Drain

author: Jason Zhao
comment: On my moto 360 after launching and closing the app, my watch keeps buzzing randomly. Only way to stop it is to restart. It'll start buzzing when I launch the app again. Stopped when I uninstalled. This is an interesting app, and I'll try it again when this problem gets fixed
title: Weird bug

author: Adam Perkins
comment: Dev tried to prevent users from uninstalling by hiding the app from the launcher. Terrible tone recognition.
title: Shady dev

author: Utku Shokohiazar
comment: AVOID THIS. couldn't even uninstall from my watch after uninstalling this from my phone. Not even accurate. Had to factory reset watch.
title: Drains battery and not even close to accurate.

author: Mateusz Florczak
comment: Still working after dismiss, clock vibrating which pushing to restart

author: Denis Prakapenka
comment: Can't exit on moto 360. Tuning not accurate either.

author: Jeffrey Smale
comment: Really good idea, but no sound detection at all
title: Doesn't detect sound

comment: Stays running in the background on 360

author: Didith Queral
comment: Nice
title: Good
